Carrying Out a Folder Analysis Using FastTrackR

Source: ../../../OneDrive - University of California, Davis/GitHub/FastTrackr/vignettes/my-vignette.Rmd
my-vignette.Rmd

Load the fasttrackr R package.

library(fasttrackr)

And change the working directory to wherever you would like all your output files to be.

### change to working directory
setwd("C:/myworkingdirectory/")

For this example I am going to use the example wav and TextGrid files included in Fast TrackR. I am going to write these out to the working directory so that the analysis will be just like one carried out using local wav and TextGrid files.

wav_example
#> Loading required package: tuneR
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'tuneR'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:fasttrackr':
#> 
#>     normalize
#> 
#> Wave Object
#>  Number of Samples:      162202
#>  Duration (seconds):     10.14
#>  Samplingrate (Hertz):   16000
#>  Channels (Mono/Stereo): Mono
#>  PCM (integer format):   TRUE
#>  Bit (8/16/24/32/64):    16
tuneR::writeWave(wav_example, "rainbowpassage.wav")

textgrid_example[1:10]
#>  [1] "File type = \"ooTextFile\""  "Object class = \"TextGrid\""
#>  [3] ""                            "xmin = 0.0"                 
#>  [5] "xmax = 10.137619047619047"   "tiers? <exists>"            
#>  [7] "size = 2"                    "item []:"                   
#>  [9] "\titem [1]:"                  "\t\tclass = \"IntervalTier\""
writeLines(textgrid_example, "rainbowpassage.TextGrid")
#extract stressed vowels using textgrid.
#extractvowels ("rainbowpassage.TextGrid", "rainbowpassage.wav", segmenttier=2,wordtier=1,stress = 1)
## this tracks the formants. I specified the boundaries and number of steps
#formants = trackformants.folder (from = 4500, to = 6500, nsteps = 20)
## run classic autoselection based on default settings.
#selectioninfo = autoselect.classic()
# get the winning analyses. You can give it the formant and selection objects
# ff_data = getwinners(formants = formants, selection_info = selectioninfo)
# or it will assume you want to use the RDS files in the working directory.
#ff_data = getwinners()
# aggregate CSV equivalent data
#aggregated = aggregatedata (csvs = ff_data)
#makecomparisonplots()
#makewinnerplots(csvs = ff_data)
# really basic plotting functions I made
#par (mfrow = c(1,1), mar = c(4,4,1,1))
#ft.lines(aggregated, xformant=2,yformant=1, revaxes = TRUE, logaxes=FALSE)
#ft.arrows(aggregated, xformant=2,yformant=1, revaxes = TRUE, logaxes=FALSE)
#ft.points(aggregated, xformant=2,yformant=1, revaxes = TRUE, logaxes=FALSE)
